page.title: 04DROWNING ON THE SEA-SHORE
page.content: {A Tragic Sea-side Accident} Blackpool's coastline has seen many tragedies, one of the most senseless being that of January 5th 1983, when a holidaymaker drowned while trying to save his dog from the rough sea. Three police officers who tried to save him were also drowned. The bodies of the four people were later recovered some distance from the scene of the drowning, near Gynn Square,where a memorial has been erected. Holidaymakers are often warned that when the sea is rough at high tide it is very dangerous to go into the water in some places along the coast, but people find this hard to believe and often disregard safety warnings, even though chains and safety barriers are put up.
